briefdescription.para: Reflect the entity's velocity off the collision surface.

detaileddescription.para: Uses the surface normal to calculate a reflected velocity vector. Commonly used for projectiles bouncing off walls.

briefdescription.para: Bounce the entity with restitution applied.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to Reflect but applies a restitution coefficient to reduce velocity. Used for physics-based bouncing.

briefdescription.para: Stick the entity to the collision surface.

detaileddescription.para: Stops the entity's movement and attaches it to the collided object. Used for projectiles that embed on impact.
Marks the entity for removal from the game world. Used for projectiles that are destroyed on impact.

briefdescription.para: Emit an event without physical response.

detaileddescription.para: Generates a collision event for game logic processing without affecting the entity's physics state.

briefdescription.para: Internal: Number of behavior types for array sizing.

simplesect.para: Do not use as a behavior value.

briefdescription.para: Defines how an entity responds to a collision event.

detaileddescription.para: CollisionBehavior values are used as bitmasks to configure per-layer collision responses in CollisionComponent. Multiple behaviors can be combined using bitwise operations.
The behavior determines what action the collision system takes when two entities collide based on their layer configuration.

simplesect.para:
Not all behaviors are currently fully implemented. Currently supported:
`Reflect` — Fully supported
`Bounce` — Fully supported
`Despawn` — Fully supported

briefdescription.para: No collision response; collision is ignored.
Aligns the entity's heading direction upon collision.

detaileddescription.para: Aligns the heading of the object to the the movement direction, typically used for bouncing or reflecting projectiles off surfaces.

briefdescription.para: Sentinel value indicating the number of response types.
Defines how an entity responds to a collision event.

detaileddescription.para: CollisionResponse is a bitmask enum that specifies the behavior when a collision is detected.

briefdescription.para: Reports only the first collision per frame.

detaileddescription.para: Once a collision is detected, the entity skips further collision checks for the current frame. This is the default policy and provides optimal performance for typical projectile behavior.

briefdescription.para: Reports all collisions with overlapping entities.

detaileddescription.para: The entity continues collision checks even after detecting a collision, generating events for every overlapping entity. Use for area-of-effect or multi-target interactions.

briefdescription.para: Specifies how many collision events an entity can receive per frame.

detaileddescription.para: HitPolicy controls the collision detection behavior when an entity overlaps multiple other entities in the same frame. This affects both performance and gameplay logic.
| Policy | Behavior | |--------|----------| | `OneHit` | Reports only the first collision detected (default) | | `All` | Reports all collisions with overlapping entities |

listitem.para: **OneHit:** Projectiles that destroy on first contact, pickups collected once
**All:** Area-of-effect damage, entities affecting multiple targets simultaneously

detaileddescription.para: ```cpp // Projectile: stops after first hit prototype.withCollision([](CollisionBuilder& b) { b.collision() .layer(Layers::PROJECTILE) .hitPolicy(HitPolicy::OneHit); });
// Explosion: damages all entities in range prototype.withCollision([](CollisionBuilder& b) { b.collision() .layer(Layers::EXPLOSION) .hitPolicy(HitPolicy::All); }); ```
